item.title: Code School - free weekend - Fly with python
item.description: Completed this course today. Level 1 - Lists and Dictionaries <2017-08-19 Sat> Dictionaries : basically used to lookup values using a key instead of an index. It maps keys to values. These are separated by a colon. Dictionaries can hold anything in terms of the value type, eg strings to string, strings to numbers and etc etc. Dictionaries are enclosed within Curly {} brackets, and lists are enclosed within square brackets [].
